abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and, the institutional development
            impacts are high. The Bank performance was satisfactory,
            given its constructive dialog, and meaningful implementation
            of the reform program. Likewise, the performance by the
            Borrower was satisfactory, for despite delayed commitments,
            reforms did overcome competing interests. Lessons point at:
            1) the critical role technical assistance projects play in
            paving the way for successful subsequent operations: to the
            extent that legal reforms, and financial diagnosis had been
            previously implemented, which enabled the establishment of
            relevant action plans under this operation; 2) the precise
            definition of privatization, as specified in the Development
            Credit Agreement, was essential, so that tranche conditions
            would not be circumvented by transactions; and, 3) the
            privatization dilemma, which given the weak economic
            conditions prevailing at the time, was aggravated by the
            potential decline of enterprise assets. However, these
            factors, and the possible subsiding of the reform agenda,
            fostered the pursuit of meaningful privatization targets, a
            strategy that proved successful.
